intro: Stemodia siliquosa, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant has slender, erect stems and small, green leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils.
